Q: Why does DeepEval GEval return 0–1 float when rubrics use 0–10 integers? A:

Yes, the result is always normalized between zero and one. The rubric range you define is used internally to guide the model when it assigns a score.

You can either keep the score normalized, or rescale it back to your original range by multiplying it by the maximum value you defined, which in your case is ten.
